newsitem.title: HONG KONG: YTL shows interest in CEPA stake.
newsitem.headline: YTL shows interest in CEPA stake.

text.p: Consolidated Electric Power Asia Ltd (CEPA) said on Friday that it had been approached by YTL Corp Bhd about the possible acquisition of a controlling interest in the power company.
But it said that no offer or formal proposal had been received from YTL.

"The board of directors of CEPA wishes to advise that...it has received an approach from YTL for the possible acquisition of a controlling interest in CEPA," the company said in a joint statement with parent Hopewell Holdings Ltd.
"However, the board of directors of CEPA would like to emphasise that no offer or formal proposal has been rececived from YTL," it added.

Hopewell announced just two weeks ago that it had agreed to sell a major part of CEPA to Southern Co's Southern Electric International. Southern Electric said on Thursday that it was hopeful its deal would go forward.
Malaysia-based YTL is involved in power generation and infrastructure development.
Shares in CEPA rose HK$0.10 to close at HK$17.95 on Thursday and Hopewell shares ended HK$0.10 lower at HK$5.35.
